quality.description:
Default image quality setting (1-100). Only used for JPEG images. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/imaging/#quality

resampleFilter.description:
Resample filter to use in resize operations. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/imaging/#resamplefilter

hint.description:
Hint about what type of image this is.
Currently only used when encoding to Webp.
Default is "photo".
Valid values are "picture", "photo", "drawing", "icon", or "text". 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/imaging/#hint

anchor.description:
The anchor to use in Fill. Default is "smart", i.e. Smart Crop. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/imaging/#anchor

bgColor.description:
Default color used in fill operations (e.g. "fff" for white). 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/imaging/#bgcolor

includeFields.description:
Regexp matching the Exif fields you want from the (massive) set of Exif info
available. As we cache this info to disk, this is for performance and
disk space reasons more than anything.
If you want it all, put ".*" in this config setting.
Note that if neither this or ExcludeFields is set, Hugo will return a small
default set. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/imaging/#includefields

excludeFields.description:
Regexp matching the Exif fields you want to exclude. This may be easier to use
than IncludeFields above, depending on what you want. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/imaging/#excludefields

disableDate.description:
Hugo extracts the "photo taken" date/time into .Date by default.
Set this to true to turn it off. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/imaging/#disabledate

disableLatLong.description:
Hugo extracts the "photo taken where" (GPS latitude and longitude) into
.Long and .Lat. Set this to true to turn it off. 
https://gohugo.io/configuration/imaging/#disablelatlong

description: ImagingConfig contains default image processing configuration.
